009package imagingbook.common.ransac;
010
011import java.util.Arrays;
012//import java.util.HashSet;
013import java.util.Random;
014
015/**
016 * Randomly draws a set of k unique, non-null elements from a given array
017 * with elements of type T, which may contain null elements.
018 * The size of the draw (k) is fixed and must be specified at construction.
019 * The resulting sets contain no duplicate elements.
020 * 
021 * @author WB
022 *
023 * @param <T> element type
024 */
025public class RandomDraw<T> {
026        
027        /**
028         * Default maximum number of tries before exception is thrown.
029         */
030        public static final int DefaultMaxTries = 1000;
031        
032        private int maxTries = DefaultMaxTries;
033        private final Random rand;
034        
035        // -------------------------------------------------------------
036        
037        /**
038         * Constructor accepting an existing random generator.
039         * This may be useful to achieve predictable (repetitive) random behavior.
040         * 
041         * @param rand a random generator of type {@link Random}
042         */
043        public RandomDraw(Random rand) {
044                this.rand = (rand == null) ? new Random() : rand;
045        }
046        
047        /**
048         * Constructor creating its own random generator.
049         */
050        public RandomDraw() {
051                this(new Random());
052        }
053        
054        /**
055         * Set the maximum number of tries.
056         * @param maxTries new maximum number of tries
057         * @see DefaultMaxTries
058         */
059        public void setMaxTries(int maxTries) {
060                this.maxTries = maxTries;
061        }
062        
063        // -------------------------------------------------------------
064        
065        // alternative version using a HashSet (slower)
066//      public T[] drawFrom(T[] items, int k) {
067//              if (k < 1) throw new IllegalArgumentException("k must be greater or equal 1");
068//              HashSet<T> hs = new HashSet<>(k);
069//              int i = 0;
070//              while (i < k) {
071//                      int j = rand.nextInt(items.length);     // next random index
072//                      T item = items[j];
073//                      if (item != null && hs.add(item)) {
074//                              i++;
075//                      }
076//              }
077//              return hs.toArray(Arrays.copyOf(items, k));
078//      }
079        
080        /**
081         * Randomly draws a set of k unique, non-null elements from the specified array
082         * of items, ignoring possible null elements. An exception is thrown if the
083         * maximum number of tries is exceeded (see {@link #DefaultMaxTries}). 
084         * The returned array contains no null elements and no duplicates.
085         * Example:
086         * <pre>
087         * Integer[] numbers = { null, 1, 2, null, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, null, null, null, 8, 9, 10, null };
088         * RandomDraw&lt;Integer&gt; rd = new RandomDraw&lt;&gt;();
089         * Integer[] draw = rd.drawFrom(numbers, 2);
090         * </pre>
091         * 
092         * @param items an array of elements of type T, null elements being allowed
093         * @param k     the number of items to draw
094         * @return an array of k randomly drawn (non-null) items
095         */
096        public T[] drawFrom(T[] items, int k) {
097                if (k < 1) throw new IllegalArgumentException("k must be greater or equal 1");
098                int[] idx = drawRandomIndexes(items, k);
099                T[] draw = Arrays.copyOf(items, k);     // trick to create an array of generic type T
100                for (int i = 0; i < k; i++) {
101                        draw[i] = items[idx[i]];
102                }
103                return draw;
104        }
105        
106        // draw k unique integers (all must be different):
107        private int[] drawRandomIndexes(T[] items, int k) {
108                int[] indexes = new int[k];
109                for (int d = 0; d < k; d++) {
110                        int j = 0;                                                      // count tries
111                        int i = rand.nextInt(items.length);
112                        while (items[i] == null || wasPickedBefore(indexes, d, i)) {
113                                i = rand.nextInt(items.length);
114                                if (j++ > maxTries) {
115                                        throw new RuntimeException("max. tries exceeded: " + j);
116                                }
117                        }
118                        indexes[d] = i;
119                }
120                return indexes;
121        }
122
123        // Checks if idx[0],...,idx[d-1] contains i.
124        private boolean wasPickedBefore(int[] indexes, int d, int i) {
125                for (int j = 0; j < d; j++) {
126                        if (i == indexes[j]) {
127                                return true;
128                        }
129                }       
130                return false;
131        }
132        
133}
